title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Intensive Accounting Practice Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic accounting terminology and understanding of financial statement structures
context.additional_context: Customized accounting education for professionals in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment, emphasizing strengthening workplace accounting application skills for medical, legal, and technical fields.

learning_goals: Learners can classify practical cases with 90% accuracy using the five elements of accounting transactions (assets, liabilities, equity, revenue, expenses).

Learners can accurately record journal entries for at least two out of three transactions by applying the three-step journalizing process (transaction analysis → account selection → debit/credit entry).
Learners can explain the cash flow statement preparation process step-by-step using a provided smartphone-optimized worksheet.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
